clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Dexmedetomidine Analgesia and Sedation in Minimally Invasive Spine Surgery Under Local Anesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Dexmedetomidine Subsidiary Analgesia and Sedation in Minimally Invasive Spine Surgery Under Local Anesthesia：A Randomized, Double Blind Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate safety and efficacy of dexmedetomidine in minimally invasive spine surgery under local anesthesia sedation.Explore the appropriate concentration of dexmedetomidine, whether or not can reduce the amount of local anesthetics.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From 1min before dexmedetomidine infusion to 2h after surgery，up to 4 hours
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation time point：1min before dexmedetomidine infusion；1min before local anesthesia；lidocaine infiltrate layer by layer to the periosteum，assessed up to 2min；Intraoperative most painful moments，assessed up to 5min；1min before returning to the ward；2h after surgery.Intraoperative most painful moments：nucleus pulpous probe or Balloon Dilatation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From 1min before dexmedetomidine infusion to 2h after surgery，up to 4 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: The patient and the surgeon satisfaction
secondary_outcome.description: four grades：Very satisfied; General satisfied; Not satisfied; Very dissatisfied
